page.title: 06WORK IN AND AROUND CURDWORTH
page.content: INDUSTRY IS SPARSE IN CURDWORTH. SEVERN-TRENT, TAME DIVISION, WORKS ARE THE 2ND LARGEST IN THE COUNTRY, VERY MECHANISED AND AUTOMATED. SEWAGE FROM ALL THE MIDLANDS IS TREATED AND THE RECLAIMED WATER RETURNED TO THE RIVERS. THE RESIDUE IS DEALT WITH AT THE SLUDGE DISPOSAL PLANT, FINALLY ALL THAT REMAINS IS ASH. HAMS HALL POWER STATION IS IN THE AREA BUT NOW PART IS SHUT DOWN AND THREE COOLING TOWERS DEMOLISHED. MOST PAST EMPLOYMENT FOR CURDWORTH PEOPLE WAS THE SEWAGE WORKS, NOW, AS IN WATER ORTON, THEY TRAVEL TO THE NEARBY TOWNS AND CONURBATION FOR EMPLOYMENT. A SMALL TRADING ESTATE AT BOTH VILLAGES, SHOPS, HOSTELRIES AND FARMS PROVIDE SOME JOBS. AT CURDWORTH OF 60 EMPLOYABLE PEOPLE 42 WERE EMPLOYED IN THE WEST MIDLANDS, 10 LOCALLY, 4 SELF EMPLOYED LOCALLY, 4 WERE UNEMPLOYED.
